block.destroy.agar_block.tooltip.summary: A _nutrient-rich_ substance, perfect for harbouring all sorts of _moulds_, _bacteria_ and _fungi_.
block.destroy.anfo_block.tooltip.behavio: Does _minimal damage_ to Mobs and _only_ explodes stones and dirt blocks, leaving ores and contraptions _untouched_.
block.destroy.cordite.tooltip.summary: An explosive that _vaporises_ anything in its way, making it optimal for mining for _Ancient Debris_.
block.destroy.cordite.tooltip.behaviour1: _Evaporates_ liquids, doesn't drop items and does _minimal damage_ to mobs.
block.destroy.dynamite_block.tooltip.sum: This explosive is _perfect_ for cleanly _excavating_ areas. The _size_ and _shape_ of the area can be configured.
block.destroy.dynamite_block.tooltip.beh: Clears out a _perfect cuboid_ (except for _indestructible_ blocks) and doesn't drop items.
block.destroy.nitrocellulose_block.toolt: Some blocks have a chance of _special drops_ due to the intense _heat and pressure_.
block.destroy.pollutometer.tooltip.summa: A super high-tech device which can _quantifiably measure_ levels of _pollution_ in the world.
block.destroy.pollutometer.tooltip.condi: When Used as Display Link Source
block.destroy.pollutometer.tooltip.behav: Displays the level of the selected type of pollution
commands.destroy.babyblueaddiction.set.m: Set Baby Blue Addiction level of %s on %s players
commands.destroy.babyblueaddiction.set.s: Set Baby Blue Addiction level of %s on %s
commands.destroy.babyblueaddiction.query: %s has a Baby Blue Addiction level of %s
commands.destroy.crudeoil: Generated %s mB of Crude Oil in the chunk at [%s, %s, %s]
commands.destroy.pollution.query: Pollution of type %s has a level of %s
commands.destroy.pollution.set: Set level of Pollution of type %s to %s. A reload may be required for some changes to take effect.
destroy.chemistry.acid: Acids are species which can donate hydrogen ions ({protons, destroy:proton}) to other species. They react with {bases, destroy:base}.
destroy.chemistry.addition: An addition reaction is one in which a group is added to a {molecule, destroy:molecule}.
destroy.chemistry.addition_elimination: An addition-elimination reaction is one in which one group is removed from a {molecule, destroy:molecule}, and only then another is added - this is unlike a {substitution, destroy:substitution}, where both happen at once.
destroy.chemistry.addition_polymer: Addition {polymers, destroy:polymer} do not {condensate, destroy:condensation_polymer} a byproduct, and often proceed by {free-radical, destroy:radical} {mechanism, destroy:mechanism}.
destroy.chemistry.aldehyde: An aldehyde is a type of [destroy:carbonyl] where the carbonyl carbon is {bonded, destroy:bond} to at least one hydrogen, unlike a {ketone, destroy:ketone}.
destroy.chemistry.alkane: Alkanes are a group of {molecules, destroy:molecule} containing only carbon and hydrogen, and only single {bonds, destroy:bond}.
destroy.chemistry.aqua_regia: Latin for 'royal water', aqua regia is a mixture of [destroy:nitric_acid] and [destroy:hydrochloric_acid] which can {dissolve, destroy:solution} {noble, destroy:inert} metals like gold.
destroy.chemistry.atom: Atoms are tiny particles consisting of {positive, destroy:charge} {nuclei, destroy:nucleus} surrounded by {negative, destroy:charge} {electrons, destroy:electron}.
destroy.chemistry.base: Bases are species which can accept hydrogen ions ({protons, destroy:proton}) from other species. They react with {acids, destroy:acid}.
destroy.chemistry.bond: Two {atoms, destroy:atom} can bond by sharing a pair of {electrons, destroy:electron}. The {positive, destroy:charge} {nuclei, destroy:nucleus} of the atoms are attracted to the {negative, destroy:charge} {electrons, destroy:electron}, requiring lots of energy to be pulled apart.
destroy.chemistry.carbonylation: A carbonylation is a reaction with [destroy:carbon_monoxide].
destroy.chemistry.carboxylation: A carboxylation is a reaction with [destroy:carbon_dioxide]. It is the opposite of a {decarboxylation, destroy:decarboxylation}.
destroy.chemistry.charge: Charge is an innate property like mass. Things can be positively or negatively charged, and oppositely-charged things will attract each other whereas same-charged things will repel.
destroy.chemistry.catalyst: A catalyst is a substance that speeds up or enables a chemical reaction, without being used up itself.
destroy.chemistry.condensation_polymer: Condensation {polymers, destroy:polymer} such as DNA and nylon 'condensate' a small {molecule, destroy:molecule} such as [destroy:water].
destroy.chemistry.cycle: A cyclic {molecule, destroy:molecule} has a least one loop in its structure.
destroy.chemistry.decarboxylation: A decarboxylation is a reaction in which [destroy:carbon_dioxide] is {eliminated, destroy:elimination} from a {molecule, destroy:molecule}. It is the opposite of {carboxylation, destroy:carboxylation}.
destroy.chemistry.degree: Degree refers to the number of carbon {atoms, destroy:atom} to which an atom is {bonded, destroy:bond}. For example, a carbon atom bonded to two others is "secondary" (has a degree of two).
destroy.chemistry.diene: A {molecule, destroy:molecule} which is a diene contains at least two {double bonds, destroy:double_bond} separated by a {single bond, destroy:bond}.
destroy.chemistry.dienophile: Dienophiles are {molecules, destroy:molecule} attracted to {dienes, destroy:diene}. Some [destroy:alkene]s and alkynes are dieneophiles.
destroy.chemistry.disproportionation: Disproportionation is when the same species is both {oxidised, destroy:oxidation} and {reduced, destroy:reduction} in a reaction.
destroy.chemistry.double_bond: If two {atoms, destroy:atom} are double-{bonded, destroy:bond}, they share two pairs of {electrons, destroy:electron} between them rather than one.
destroy.chemistry.electron: Electrons are low-mass, {negatively, destroy:charge} charged {subatomic, destroy:subatomic} particles.
destroy.chemistry.electrophile: An electrophile is a species which can accept an {electron, destroy:electron} pair. They are the opposite of {nucleophiles, destroy:nucleophile}.
destroy.chemistry.elimination: An elimination reaction is one in which a group is removed from a {molecule, destroy:molecule}.
destroy.chemistry.endothermic: Endothermic reactions take in heat. They are the opposite of {exothermic, destroy:exothermic} reactions.
destroy.chemistry.exothermic: Exothermic reactions produce heat. They are the opposite of {endothermic, destroy:endothermic} reactions.
destroy.chemistry.halide: The halides are the {ions, destroy:ion} of the {halogens, destroy:halogen}.
destroy.chemistry.halogen: The halogens are the group of elements including Fluorine, [destroy:chlorine], Bromine and [destroy:iodine].
destroy.chemistry.hydrolysis: A hydrolysis is a reaction with [destroy:water].
destroy.chemistry.hydrogenation: A hydrogenation reaction is a type of {reduction, destroy:reduction} with [destroy:hydrogen].
destroy.chemistry.hygroscopic: Hygroscopic substances have a great affinity for taking in [destroy:water].
destroy.chemistry.ion: Ions are {charged, destroy:charge} {atoms, destroy:atom} or {molecules, destroy:molecule}.
destroy.chemistry.ketone: A ketone is a type of [destroy:carbonyl] where the carbonyl carbon is {bonded, destroy:bond} to two other carbons (and no hydrogens), unlike an {aldehyde, destroy:aldehyde}.
destroy.chemistry.mechanism: A mechanism describes how a reaction happens - where {electrons, destroy:electron} move; what intermediate species there are.
destroy.chemistry.mixed_xylenes: 'Mixed xylenes' is the name for the mixture of [destroy:metaxylene], [destroy:orthoxylene], [destroy:paraxylene] and [destroy:ethylbenzene].
destroy.chemistry.nucleophile: A nucleophile is a species which can donate an {electron, destroy:electron} pair. They are attracted to {positive, destroy:charge} areas ({nuclei, destroy:nucleus} are positive, hence the name). They are the opposite of {electrophiles, destroy:electrophile}.
destroy.chemistry.neutron: A neutron is a neutral (not {charged, destroy:charge}) particle found in the {nucleus, destroy:nucleus} of an {atom, destroy:atom}.
destroy.chemistry.nucleus: At the center of each {atom, destroy:atom} is a nucleus, consisting of {protons, destroy:proton} and {neutrons, destroy:neutron}.
destroy.chemistry.oxidation: An {atom, destroy:atom} is oxidised when it loses {electron(s), destroy:electron}, often by reaction with [destroy:oxygen]. Oxidation is the opposite of {reduction, destroy:reduction}.
destroy.chemistry.proton: A proton is a {positive, destroy:charge} {subatomic, destroy:subatomic} particle found in the {nucleus, destroy:nucleus}. The number of protons in an {atom, destroy:atom} determines what element it is.
destroy.chemistry.polarity: A polar {molecule, destroy:molecule} has a {positive, destroy:charge} end and a {negative, destroy:charge} end.
destroy.chemistry.polymer: 'Poly' is Greek for 'many', as polymers are {molecules, destroy:molecule} containing many repeating 'monomers'. Plastics are all polymers, and types include {addition-, destroy:addition_polymer} and {condensation-, destroy:condensation_polymer} polymers.
destroy.chemistry.precipitation: Precipitation is when a dissolved species comes out of {solution, destroy:solution}.
destroy.chemistry.radical: While most species contain {electrons, destroy:electron} in pairs, radicals are species with unpaired electrons, and are often very reactive.
destroy.chemistry.radical_initiator: Radical initiators are species which produce {radicals, destroy:radical}, and can kick-start a {polymerisation, destroy:polymer} reaction.
destroy.chemistry.reduction: An {atom, destroy:atom} is reduced when it gains {electron(s), destroy:electron}. Reduction is the opposite of {oxidation, destroy:oxidation}.
destroy.chemistry.sequestration: Sequestration is the capture of a gas, to allow it to be stored as a solid or liquid.
destroy.chemistry.solution: A solution contains a solute dissolved in a solvent.
destroy.chemistry.substitution: A substitution reaction is one in which one group on a {molecule, destroy:molecule} is quickly replaced by another.
destroy.chemistry.syngas: Synthesis gas, or 'syngas' is a mixture of [destroy:carbon_dioxide] and [destroy:hydrogen].
destroy.chemistry.thermal_decomposition: Thermal decomposition, or pyrolysis, is the spontaneous breakdown of a species when heated.
destroy.chemistry.transalkylation: Transalkylation is the transfer of {alkyl groups, destroy:alkane} between [destroy:benzene] rings.
destroy.chemistry.ultraviolet_catalysed_: This reaction is {catalysed, destroy:catalyst} by UV light, from the sun, Blacklights or similar blocks. Ponder the Vat Controller to learn more.
destroy.chemistry.unknown_definition: Unknown definition - report this as a bug.
destroy.ponder.tag.chemistry.description: Components which can be used to manipulate Mixtures
destroy.ponder.tag.destroy.description: Components and Curiosities added by Destroy
destroy.ponder.tag.vat_side_blocks.descr: Blocks from which Vats can be constructed
destroy.ponder.aging_barrel.header: Fermenting beverages with the Ageing Barrel
destroy.ponder.aging_barrel.text_1: Ageing Barrels, like Basins, can be filled with fluids and items.
destroy.ponder.aging_barrel.text_2: Over a long time, the Ageing Barrel will create a new fluid.
destroy.ponder.aging_barrel.text_3: The Ageing Barrel is also the workplace of the Innkeeper, who sells Yeast at the Apprentice level.
destroy.ponder.bubble_cap_generic.text_1: Vertically stacked Bubble Caps create a Distillation Tower.
destroy.ponder.bubble_cap_generic.text_2: Distillation Towers will automatically distill fluids in the bottom-most Cap (the Reboiler).
destroy.ponder.bubble_cap_generic.text_3: The higher the boiling point of the fluid, the further up the Tower it will travel.
destroy.ponder.bubble_cap_generic.text_4: Some Distillation recipes require a heater underneath the Reboiler.
destroy.ponder.bubble_cap_mixtures.text_: Distillation towers will distill any Mixtures.
You can see the temperature of the Reboiler with Goggles.
It can be increased with a Blaze Burner.
Species with a boiling point higher than this will remained mixed in the Reboiler.
Gases with a boiling point lower than room temperature will remain mixed in the top Cap.
All other species will form fractions according to their boiling point.
The more Bubble Caps, the more fractions.
All this allows you to separate species whose boiling points aren't too low or high.
Use a Display Link to more easily see the contents of a fraction.
destroy.ponder.centrifuge_generic.text_1: The Centrifuge will slowly separate any fluid pumped into the top.
destroy.ponder.centrifuge_generic.text_2: The denser resultant fluid can be extracted from the side.
destroy.ponder.centrifuge_generic.text_3: The lighter resultant fluid can be extracted from the bottom.
destroy.ponder.centrifuge_generic.text_4: The Centrifuge does not actively pump out fluids - a Mechanical Pump must be used.
destroy.ponder.centrifuge_generic.text_5: Lubrication can be applied to increase the processing speed.
destroy.ponder.centrifuge_mixture.text_1: Centrifuges can also be used to separate Mixtures into their component species, based on their densities.
destroy.ponder.centrifuge_mixture.text_2: They will always produce two products of equal volume.
destroy.ponder.centrifuge_mixture.text_3: Species are separated based on their liquid densities.
destroy.ponder.coaxial_gear_shaftless.he: Using Coaxial Cogwheels as shaftless Cogwheels
destroy.ponder.coaxial_gear_shaftless.te: Coaxial Cogwheels connect similarly to regular Cogwheels.
However, they have no Shaft, allowing for configurations that would be impossible with regular Cogwheels.
destroy.ponder.coaxial_gear_through.head: Rotating Shafts through Coaxial Cogwheels
destroy.ponder.coaxial_gear_through.text: Use a Coaxial Cogwheel on a Shaft to surround it.
You can also use a Shaft on a Coaxial Cogwheel.
In either case, there must be at least two Shaft blocks.
The Shaft rotates completely independently of the Coaxial Cogwheel.
They can even rotate at different speeds and in different directions.
destroy.ponder.cooler.text_1: Right-click a Stray with an Empty Blaze Burner to capture it.
destroy.ponder.cooler.text_2: Your new friend can be used to cool Basins.
destroy.ponder.cooler.text_3: Unlike the Blaze Burner, the Refrigerstraytor can only run off of Mixtures, piped in the bottom.
destroy.ponder.cooler.text_4: This Mixture must contain species with the 'Refrigerant' tag.
destroy.ponder.cooler.text_6: Higher-concentration refrigerants will keep the Refrigerstraytor cold for longer.
destroy.ponder.cooler.text_7: Once cold, it is required for some recipes.
destroy.ponder.differential.text_1: Differentials rotate at the average speed of the two input Shafts.
destroy.ponder.differential.text_2: When connected to a small Cog, this is effectively summing the two speeds.
destroy.ponder.differential.text_6: Shafts spinning in the opposite direction are treated like negative numbers.
destroy.ponder.differential.text_10: While connected to two Shafts, the Differential only transfers the stress to the large Cogwheel through one.
destroy.ponder.differential.text_13: If the outer gear is powered, the Differential will break.
destroy.ponder.double_cardan_shaft.heade: Relaying rotational force with Double Cardan Shafts
destroy.ponder.double_cardan_shaft.text_: Using two mechanisms called 'universal joints', Double Cardan Shafts can relay rotatation around a corner.
Use a Wrench to rotate them around the axis you clicked.
destroy.ponder.dynamo_redstone.header: Creating Redstone signals with the Dynamo
destroy.ponder.dynamo_redstone.text_1: A Dynamo will confer a Redstone signal to the block directly beneath.
destroy.ponder.dynamo_redstone.text_2: The strength of the signal is proportional to the rotational speed of the Dynamo.
destroy.ponder.dynamo_charging.text_1: The Dynamo can process items provided beneath it.
destroy.ponder.dynamo_charging.text_2: Items can be dropped or placed on a Depot underneath the Dynamo.
destroy.ponder.dynamo_electrolysis.text_: A Dynamo placed two blocks above a Basin can be used to carry out electrolysis recipes.
destroy.ponder.extrusion_die.header: Extruding blocks with the Extrusion Die
destroy.ponder.extrusion_die.text_1: The Extrusion Die can transform some blocks when they are pushed through it.
destroy.ponder.extrusion_die.text_2: The Extrusion Die must remain static.
destroy.ponder.reactions.text_1: Vats, and Basins with Mixers can be used to react Mixtures of chemicals.
destroy.ponder.reactions.text_2: Destroy simulates this on the Molecular level - reactions happen according to the real laws of chemistry.
destroy.ponder.reactions.text_3: For example, reactions can be sped up by increasing the temperature and concentration of reactants.
destroy.ponder.reactions.text_4: Use JEI to see the array of reactions possible. Hover over highlighted terms to see their definitions.
destroy.ponder.phytomining.text_1: Hyperaccumulating Fertiliser can be used like Bone Meal to mutate certain crops.
destroy.ponder.phytomining.text_2: Some mutations result in the uptake of ores placed a block below the farmland.
destroy.ponder.planetary_gearset.header: Out-of-this-world gearing with the Planetary Gearset
destroy.ponder.planetary_gearset.text_1: Planetary Gearsets connect almost identically to Large Cogwheels (press Q to learn more about these).
destroy.ponder.planetary_gearset.text_2: However, the Shaft of a Planetary Gearset rotates twice as fast, and in the opposite direction to the teeth.
destroy.ponder.pumpjack.header: Extracting Crude Oil with the Pumpjack
destroy.ponder.pumpjack.text_1: Locate Crude Oil with a Handheld Seismometer.
destroy.ponder.pumpjack.text_2: When powered anywhere in a chunk containing an oil reserve, the Pumpjack will slowly extract Crude Oil.
destroy.ponder.pumpjack.text_3: The Pumpjack does not actively pump out the Oil - a Mechanical Pump must still be used.
destroy.ponder.vat_construction.text_1: To make a Vat, first create an enclosed shell.
destroy.ponder.vat_construction.text_2: The only space should be for the Controller.
destroy.ponder.vat_construction.text_3: Vats can only be made out of certain blocks.
destroy.ponder.vat_construction.text_4: You can view all these blocks in the 'Vat Materials' section on the left.
destroy.ponder.vat_construction.text_5: These blocks can be combined in any way. What blocks you choose will affect the Vat's behaviour.
destroy.ponder.vat_construction.text_6: Vats can have many sizes, ranging from a single block of interior space...
destroy.ponder.vat_construction.text_8: They don't have to be cubic.
destroy.ponder.vat_construction.text_9: Like the blocks of which it's made, the shape and size of a Vat also affects its behaviour - for example, its capacity.
destroy.ponder.vat_construction.text_10: The edges of a Vat are not needed, and do not form part of the Vat.
destroy.ponder.vat_interaction.text_1: Use a Wrench on the outer side of a Vat to see its internal temperature.
destroy.ponder.vat_interaction.text_2: This does not work on the edges or corners.
destroy.ponder.vat_interaction.text_3: Wrench it again to see the pressure.
destroy.ponder.vat_interaction.text_4: Chemicals can be pulled and pushed from Vats with Fluid Pipes and Pumps.
destroy.ponder.vat_interaction.text_5: Pay close attention to the tooltip when hovering over a Pipe. If it is above the liquid level, it will only extract gas.
destroy.ponder.vat_interaction.text_6: Items can be pulled in and out through any side of the Vat.
destroy.ponder.vat_interaction.text_7: Wrench the top of a Vat to turn it into a vent. This will let out any gas and replace it with air.
destroy.ponder.vat_interaction.text_8: The vent can be opened and closed with redstone.
destroy.ponder.vat_interaction.text_9: Vats can be heated with Blaze Burners and cooled with Refrigerstrayters. This affects the rate of reactions.
destroy.ponder.uv.text_1: Some Reactions require ultraviolet light as a catalyst.
destroy.ponder.uv.text_2: Vats receive UV through transparent blocks in the top, regardless of the time of day.
destroy.ponder.uv.text_3: More UV power is supplied by Blacklights placed directly adjacent to transparent sides of the Vat.
destroy.generic_reaction.acyl_chloride_e: The joining of an [destroy:acyl_chloride] and an [destroy:alcohol] to make an [destroy:ester].
destroy.generic_reaction.acyl_chloride_f: The formation of an [destroy:acyl_chloride] from a [destroy:carboxylic_acid].
destroy.generic_reaction.acyl_chloride_h: The rapid reaction of an [destroy:acyl_chloride] with [destroy:water].
destroy.generic_reaction.alcohol_oxidati: The {oxidation, destroy:oxidation} of a non-{tertiary, destroy:degree} [destroy:alcohol] to a [destroy:carbonyl]. Carry out at low temperature to prevent further {oxidation, destroy:oxidation}.
destroy.generic_reaction.aldehyde_oxidat: The {oxidation, destroy:oxidation} of an {aldehyde, destroy:aldehyde} to a [destroy:carboxylic_acid].
destroy.generic_reaction.alkene_hydrolys: The {hydrolysis, destroy:hydrolysis} of an [destroy:alkene] to form an [destroy:alcohol]. The alcohol group gets added to the higher {degree, destroy:degree} carbon.
destroy.generic_reaction.alkene_hydrogen: The nickel-{catalysed, destroy:catalyst} {hydrogenation, destroy:hydrogenation} of an [destroy:alkene].
destroy.generic_reaction.amide_hydrolysi: The {hydrolysis, destroy:hydrolysis} of an [destroy:amide] to produce a [destroy:carboxylic_acid].
destroy.generic_reaction.carbonyl_reduct: The {reduction, destroy:reduction} of a [destroy:carbonyl] to a [destroy:alcohol].
destroy.generic_reaction.carboxylic_acid: The [destroy:sulfuric_acid]-{catalysed, destroy:catalyst} joining of an [destroy:alcohol] and [destroy:carboxylic_acid] to make an [destroy:ester], in {anhydrous, destroy:anhydrous} conditions.
The {reduction, destroy:reduction} of a [destroy:carboxylic_acid] to an {aldehyde, destroy:aldehyde}. Carry out at low temperature to prevent further {reduction, destroy:reduction}.
destroy.generic_reaction.cyanide_nucleop: The {nucleophilic, destroy:nucleophile} {addition, destroy:addition} of [destroy:cyanide] to a [destroy:carbonyl].
destroy.generic_reaction.halide_amine_su: The {nucleophilic, destroy:nucleophile} {substitution, destroy:substitution} of a hydrogen from an [destroy:non_tertiary_amine] for an organo{halide, destroy:halide} (any {halide, destroy:halide}, not just a [destroy:chloride]).
destroy.generic_reaction.halide_ammonia_: The {nucleophilic, destroy:nucleophile} {substitution, destroy:substitution} of any organo{halide, destroy:halide} (not just a [destroy:chloride]) for an [destroy:amine] group.
destroy.generic_reaction.halide_cyanide_: The {nucleophilic, destroy:nucleophile} {substitution, destroy:substitution} of any organo{halide, destroy:halide} (not just a [destroy:chloride]) for an [destroy:nitrile] group.
destroy.generic_reaction.halide_hydroxid: The {nucleophilic, destroy:nucleophile} {substitution, destroy:substitution} of any organo{halide, destroy:halide} (not just a [destroy:chloride]) for an [destroy:alcohol] group.
destroy.generic_reaction.nitrile_hydroge: The nickel-{catalysed, destroy:catalyst} {hydrogenation, destroy:hydrogenation} of a [destroy:nitrile] to produce an [destroy:amine].
destroy.generic_reaction.nitrile_hydroly: The {hydrolysis, destroy:hydrolysis} of a [destroy:nitrile] to produce an [destroy:amide].
destroy.generic_reaction.thionyl_chlorid: The conversion of an [destroy:alcohol] into an {alkyl, destroy:alkane} [destroy:chloride] via {nucleophilic, destroy:nucleophile} {substitution, destroy:substitution}.
destroy.reaction.abs_copolymerization.de: The {free-radical, destroy:radical} {addition copolymerisation, destroy:addition_polymer} of [destroy:acrylonitrile], [destroy:butadiene] and [destroy:styrene].
destroy.reaction.aibn_synthesis.descript: A two-step synthesis in reality, which produces the {radical initiator, destroy:radical_initiator} [destroy:aibn].
destroy.reaction.andrussow_process.descr: A high-temperature platinum-{catalysed, destroy:catalyst} method for the production of [destroy:hydrogen_cyanide].
destroy.reaction.anthraquinone_process.d: The second step in the production of [destroy:hydrogen_peroxide] by the {reduction, destroy:reduction} of [destroy:oxygen] by [destroy:ethylanthrahydroquinone].
destroy.reaction.anthraquinone_reduction: The first step in the production of [destroy:hydrogen_peroxide] - {hydrogenating, destroy:hydrogenation} [destroy:ethylanthraquinone].
destroy.reaction.baby_blue_precipitation: The addition of {ions, destroy:ion} to the solution increases its {polarity, destroy:polarity}, causing the [destroy:methyl_salicylate] to {precipitate, destroy:precipitation}.
destroy.reaction.basic_diels_alder_react: A Diels-Alder reaction is a type of {cyclisation, destroy:cycle} that occurs between a {diene, destroy:diene} and a {dienophile, destroy:dienophile}.
destroy.reaction.benzene_ethylation.desc: An {acid, destroy:acid}-{catalysed, destroy:catalyst} method to produce [destroy:ethylbenzene].
destroy.reaction.calcium_hydroxide_soap_: The ancient technique of turning animal fat and slaked lime (calcium hydroxide) into soap and glycerol.
destroy.reaction.carbon_capture.descript: A method of {sequestering, destroy:sequestration} [destroy:carbon_dioxide] by reaction with calcium oxide.
destroy.reaction.carbon_tetrachloride_fl: The {substitution, destroy:substitution} of chlorine for fluorine in [destroy:carbon_tetrachloride] to produce various fluorinated products.
destroy.reaction.cellulose_nitration.des: A method for the production of Nitrocellulose by reacting cellulose with [destroy:nitric_acid] and [destroy:sulfuric_acid].

effect.destroy.cancer.description: _Has no effect in-game_. Many things in Destroy are jokes, but _cancer is not one of them_. destroy.explosion_condition.sound_activa: Can be set off by loud sounds
destroy.explosive_property.brisance.desc: The additional spread of launched shots
destroy.explosive_property.energy.descri: The higher, the stronger the explosion
The provided propulsion, stress and recoil
destroy.explosive_property.oxygen_balanc: The further from zero, the weaker the explosion
The higher from zero, the greater the propulsion
destroy.explosive_property.temperature.d: The hotter, the greater the stress on the cannon
destroy.ponder.arc_furnace.text_1: Place a suitable electrode Block (Carbon Fiber, unless changed by an add-on or modpack) between a Basin and Dynamo.
destroy.ponder.arc_furnace.text_4: Arc Furnaces can do Blasting Recipes quickly.
destroy.ponder.arc_furnace.text_5: Some Recipes specifically require an Arc Furnace.
destroy.ponder.blowpipe.text_2: Dunk the Blowpipe in a Basin of the right Fluid...
destroy.ponder.blowpipe.text_4: Once done, hit against a block to dislodge the product.
destroy.ponder.blowpipe.text_5: Shift-click to change the selected Recipe.
destroy.ponder.blowpipe.automation.text_: Once a Recipe is selected, Blowpipes can be filled by Spout.
They can also be dunked directly by Deployers.
Static Deployers will place Blowpipes parallel to their Shafts.
To place in the opposite direction, reverse the rotation of the Deployer.
destroy.ponder.bubble_cap.text_1: Vertically stacked Bubble Caps create a Distillation Tower.
destroy.ponder.bubble_cap.text_2: Distillation Towers will automatically distill fluids in the bottom-most Cap (the Reboiler).
destroy.ponder.bubble_cap.text_3: The higher the boiling point of the fluid, the further up the Tower it will travel.
destroy.ponder.bubble_cap.text_4: Some Distillation recipes require a heater underneath the Reboiler.
destroy.ponder.bubble_cap.mixtures.text_: Distillation towers will distill any Mixtures.
You can see the temperature of the Reboiler with Goggles.
It can be increased with a Blaze Burner.
Species with a boiling point higher than this will remained mixed in the Reboiler.
Gases with a boiling point lower than room temperature will remain mixed in the top Cap.
All other species will form fractions according to their boiling point.
The more Bubble Caps, the more fractions.
All this allows you to separate species whose boiling points aren't too low or high.
Use a Display Link to more easily see the contents of a fraction.
destroy.ponder.centrifuge.text_1: The Centrifuge will slowly separate any fluid pumped into the top.
destroy.ponder.centrifuge.text_2: The denser resultant fluid can be extracted from the side.
destroy.ponder.centrifuge.text_3: The lighter resultant fluid can be extracted from the bottom.
destroy.ponder.centrifuge.text_4: The Centrifuge does not actively pump out fluids - a Mechanical Pump must be used.
destroy.ponder.centrifuge.text_5: Lubrication can be applied to increase the processing speed.
destroy.ponder.centrifuge.mixture.text_1: Centrifuges can also be used to separate Mixtures into their component species, based on their densities.
destroy.ponder.centrifuge.mixture.text_2: They will always produce two products of equal volume.
destroy.ponder.centrifuge.mixture.text_3: Species are separated based on their liquid densities.
destroy.ponder.colorimeter.text_1: Colorimeters can read the concentration of certain species if placed facing a Vat.
destroy.ponder.colorimeter.text_2: The Block they are touching must be transparent.
destroy.ponder.colorimeter.text_3: They give an interpolated Redstone signal based on the concentration they observe.
destroy.ponder.cooler.text_8: Using a Creative Blaze Cake can turn the Refrigerstrayer off, or on indefinitely.
destroy.ponder.dynamo.redstone.header: Creating Redstone signals with the Dynamo
destroy.ponder.dynamo.redstone.text_1: A Dynamo will confer a Redstone signal to the block directly beneath.
destroy.ponder.dynamo.redstone.text_2: The strength of the signal is proportional to the rotational speed of the Dynamo.
destroy.ponder.dynamo.charging.text_1: The Dynamo can process items provided beneath it.
destroy.ponder.dynamo.charging.text_2: Items can be dropped or placed on a Depot underneath the Dynamo.
destroy.ponder.dynamo.electrolysis.text_: A Dynamo placed two blocks above a Basin can be used to carry out electrolysis recipes.
destroy.ponder.explosives.dyeing.text_1: Explosive Mix Blocks can be dyed any color by crafting with Dyes.
destroy.ponder.explosives.dyeing.text_2: Dyes can also be applied directly to the block.
destroy.ponder.explosives.dyeing.text_3: Clipboards will copy the color, at no extra Dye cost.
destroy.ponder.explosives.filling.text_1: Explosive Mix Blocks can be filled with explosives by crafting them together.
destroy.ponder.explosives.filling.text_2: They can also be filled in-world by all normal methods.
destroy.ponder.explosives.filling.text_3: They can also be filled in the GUI, which will let you see the Explosive Properties of the explosive.
destroy.ponder.explosives.filling.text_4: Clipboards will attempt to copy Explosive Mix Blocks' contents by taking items from your inventory.
destroy.ponder.explosives.exploding.head: The effects of Explosive Mix explosions
destroy.ponder.explosives.exploding.text: The items an Explosive Mix Block is filled with and its Explosive Properties affects what its explosion does.
For example, it could Silk Touch blocks, or evaporate fluids.
To get some special drops, the  Brisance must be high enough to fulfill the 'Obliteration' condition.
destroy.ponder.explosives.naming.text_1: Mixed Explosives, like all items, can be named with an Anvil.
destroy.ponder.explosives.naming.text_2: The first few letters of the name will show on the sides of the block.
destroy.ponder.explosives.naming.text_4: This only works with Destroy's 'Mixed Explosives', not the Mixed Charge or Mixed Shell included if you have 'Create: Big Cannons' installed.
destroy.ponder.mechanical_sieve.text_1: Loose Items on top of a powered Mechanical Sieve will split into parts.
destroy.ponder.mechanical_sieve.text_2: You may find that you get exactly what you want the first time you do some recipes. Call it beginners' luck...
destroy.ponder.periodic_table.text_1: Here is every element available as a periodic table block.
destroy.ponder.periodic_table.text_2: Other modpacks or add-ons might add more.
destroy.ponder.periodic_table.text_3: Assembling every element block shown here like this will earn you a reward.
destroy.ponder.pollution.tanks.text_1: Open pipes will release fluids, including Mixtures, into the atmosphere.
destroy.ponder.pollution.tanks.text_2: Destroying any blocks containing fluids will do the same.
destroy.ponder.pollution.tanks.text_3: This can increase  Smog,  Greenhouse Gas concentration,  Rain Acidity and  Ozone Depletion in the world.
destroy.ponder.pollution.basins_and_vats: Basins cannot hold any gas, and any they produce will be released, polluting the world.
Wrenching the top of a Vat adds a vent, which will release any gases contained in the vent and replace them with air.
The vent can be opened and closed with Redstone.
destroy.ponder.pollution.smog.text_1: As the level of  Smog increases in the world, everything will slowly turn browner.
destroy.ponder.pollution.crop_growth_fai: The effect of pollution on plant growth
As levels of  Smog,  Greenhouse Gases and  Rain Acidity increase, there is an increasing chance that crops will fail to grow.
This also applies when using Bonemeal on crops.
Hyperaccumulating Fertilizer works regardless of pollution levels.
destroy.ponder.pollution.fishing_failure: The effect of pollution on fishing
As the level of  Smog increases in the world, fishing will yield fewer fish and more junk.
destroy.ponder.pollution.breeding_failur: The effect of pollution on animal breeding
As the level of  Smog increases in the world, there is an increasing chance for animals to fail to breed.
destroy.ponder.pollution.villager_price_: The effect of pollution on Villagers' prices
As the level  Smog increases in the world, Villagers get annoyed by the ugliness and raise their prices for all Players.
destroy.ponder.pollution.cancer.header: The danger of destroying the ozone layer
destroy.ponder.pollution.cancer.text_1: As the level of  Ozone Depletion increases, more UV light penetrates the atmosphere.
destroy.ponder.pollution.cancer.text_2: This increases the risk of skin cancer when outside in hot biomes.
destroy.ponder.pollution.cancer.text_3: This has no effect in Destroy, but you should always wear sunscreen!
destroy.ponder.pollution.acid_rain.text_: As the level of  Rain Acidity increases in the world, rain becomes greener.
There is also an increasing risk that exposed organics will be killed.
destroy.ponder.pollution.room_temperatur: As levels of  Greenhouse Gases and  Ozone Depletion increase, outdoor temperature rises.
This affects the chemicals which will be collected at the tops of Distillation Towers.
It also affects the rate of heat transfer in and out of Vats.
destroy.ponder.pollution.reduction.text_: All types of pollution slowly decrease over time.
Levels of  Smog,  Greenhouse Gases and  Rain Acidity can be decreased further by planting trees.
However, just like real life, this is just a patchwork solution and the only real way to fix our effect on the environment is to cut down on emissions.
destroy.ponder.pollution.lightning.text_: Whenever lightning strikes in the world, some ozone is generated, decreasing the level of  Ozone Depletion.
destroy.ponder.pollution.catalytic_conve: Reducing harmful emissions with Catalytic Converters
When placed on the end of pipes, Catalytic Converters reduce the amount of pollution released by fluids.
destroy.ponder.redstone_programmer.text_: Click on a Redstone Link with a Redstone Programmer to add that channel to the Programmer.
With JEI installed, you can also drag in items manually in the GUI.
Shift-click to place the Programmer in the world.
While placed or in a Player's inventory, Programmers can broadcast sequences of wireless Redstone signals.
destroy.ponder.seismometer.header: Locating Crude Void Oil with the Seismometer
destroy.ponder.seismometer.text_1: Add a Seismometer to a filled Map in a Cartography Table to turn it into a Seismograph.
destroy.ponder.seismometer.text_2: The Map must not be empty.
destroy.ponder.seismometer.text_4: If you are holding a Seismometer and Seismograph covering that area, and there is a nearby explosion, information will be added to the Seismograph.
destroy.ponder.seismometer.text_5: Any explosion will do (even a Creeper), but Touch Powder can be made early on and isn't destructive.
destroy.ponder.seismometer.text_6: Intepreting the Seismograph can help you work out where Oil might be.
destroy.ponder.seismograph.text_1: When a Seismometer activates, it will mark on any Seismographs in your inventory whether the chunk you were in is seismically active (a check) or not (a cross).
destroy.ponder.seismograph.text_2: It also tells you the number of seismically active chunks in the row and column on the Seismograph.
destroy.ponder.seismograph.text_3: You can mark chunks you think are or are not seismically active by clicking.
destroy.ponder.seismograph.text_4: The number of colored pixels on the side tells you how many seismically active chunks are in a row in that row, but does not tell you where they are.
destroy.ponder.seismograph.text_5: (This type of puzzle is called a nonogram).
destroy.ponder.seismograph.text_7: If there are multiple numbers, then there are multiple groups in that row.
destroy.ponder.seismograph.text_8: They are in order. For example, if the column says "2 1", then there are two contiguous seismically active chunks...
destroy.ponder.seismograph.text_10: If there are multiple numbers, the contiguous sets never touch.
destroy.ponder.seismograph.text_13: If you collect enough data you can work out which chunks are seismically active.
destroy.ponder.seismograph.text_14: But it will take a bit of lateral thinking!
destroy.ponder.seismograph.text_15: Chunks containing Oil are always seismically active, and so are the four chunks touching them.
destroy.ponder.seismograph.text_16: This means that Oil can only be found in the center of "plusses".
destroy.ponder.seismograph.text_17: While seismically active chunks are somewhat random, if you can form a "plus" there will usually be Oil at the center of it.
destroy.ponder.seismograph.text_20: So drill in the center of big blobs of seismically active chunks!
destroy.ponder.siphon.header: Measuring Fluid with the Redstone Siphon
destroy.ponder.siphon.text_1: Redstone Siphons allow for the transfer of a fixed amount of Fluid.
destroy.ponder.siphon.text_2: When given a Redstone pulse, they will allow a fixed amount of Fluid out.
destroy.ponder.siphon.text_4: Click and hold to configure this amount.
destroy.ponder.siphon.text_6: If pulsed multiple times, multiples of the configured amount will be let out.
destroy.ponder.tree_tap.text_1: When given rotational power, the Tapper can extract fluid from trees.
destroy.ponder.tree_tap.text_2: The fluid can be pumped out the back.
destroy.ponder.trypolithography_intro.te: The creation of Circuit Boards requires punching Circuit Masks with the correct pattern.
Keypunches will punch holes in Circuit Masks on Depots and Belts underneath.
Click the Keypunch to configure which hole it punches.
A single Mask can only be punched by up to three different Keypunches before being too contaminated.
destroy.ponder.trypolithography_rotating: Getting around (and around) the contamination limit
Circuit Masks can only be punched by up to three Keypunches, but usually require more than three holes.
One way to get around this is rotating Masks to use the same Keypunch more than once.
The additional hole will not count as a new contaminant.
Any relative rotation between the Keypunch and Mask will work.
destroy.ponder.trypolithography_flipping: When launched by a Weighted Ejector, Circuit Masks flip over.
This is another way to allow the same Keypunch to punch multiple holes, avoiding contamination.
destroy.ponder.vat.construction.text_1: To make a Vat, first create an enclosed shell.
destroy.ponder.vat.construction.text_2: The only space should be for the Controller.
destroy.ponder.vat.construction.text_3: Vats can only be made out of certain blocks.
destroy.ponder.vat.construction.text_4: You can view all these blocks in the 'Vat Materials' section on the left.
destroy.ponder.vat.construction.text_5: These blocks can be combined in any way. What blocks you choose will affect the Vat's behaviour.
destroy.ponder.vat.construction.text_6: Vats can have many sizes, ranging from a single block of interior space...
destroy.ponder.vat.construction.text_8: They don't have to be cubic.
destroy.ponder.vat.construction.text_9: Like the blocks of which it's made, the shape and size of a Vat also affects its behaviour - for example, its capacity.
destroy.ponder.vat.construction.text_10: The edges of a Vat are not needed, and do not form part of the Vat.
destroy.ponder.vat.fluids.header: Getting Fluids in and out of Vats
destroy.ponder.vat.fluids.text_1: Fluids can be pumped in and out of Vats on any face.
destroy.ponder.vat.fluids.text_2: As gases cannot be infinitely compressed, the Vat can never be completely filled with liquid.
destroy.ponder.vat.fluids.text_3: Edges and corners do not allow access to the Vat.
destroy.ponder.vat.fluids.text_4: Only Mixtures - and some Fluids which convert to Mixtures - can go in a Vat.
destroy.ponder.vat.fluids.text_5: Mixtures can only really go in Vats and Basins - not usually tanks from other mods.
destroy.ponder.vat.fluids.text_7: Vats store both a liquid phase and a gas phase.
destroy.ponder.vat.fluids.text_8: The liquid level inside the Vat will determine whether a pipe pulls out liquid or gas.
destroy.ponder.vat.fluids.text_9: Mixtures cannot be filtered with Smart Pipes (or any Filter).
destroy.ponder.vat.items.header: Getting Items in and out of Vats
destroy.ponder.vat.items.text_1: Items can be pulled in and out of Vats with Funnels on any face.
destroy.ponder.vat.items.text_2: Again, the edges and corners do not count.
destroy.ponder.vat.temperature.text_1: Wrench the side of a Vat to add a thermometer, which will read the Vat's internal temperature.
destroy.ponder.vat.temperature.text_2: The internal temperature of Vats tries to equilibriate to match the temperature outside.
destroy.ponder.vat.temperature.text_3: The rate at which this occurs is goverened by Fourier's Law, and depends on the conductivity of the blocks used to build the Vat.
destroy.ponder.vat.temperature.text_4: Lit Blaze Burners supply a small constant amount of heating power, which results in a higher equilibrium temperature.
destroy.ponder.vat.temperature.text_5: The heating power can be increased with more Blaze Burners, and by superheating them.
destroy.ponder.vat.temperature.text_6: Refrigerstraytors withdraw a constant amount of heating power from the Vat.
destroy.ponder.vat.pressure.text_1: Wrench the side of a Vat twice to add a barometer.
destroy.ponder.vat.pressure.text_2: This shows the pressure exerted outwards by the gas inside the Vat.
destroy.ponder.vat.pressure.text_3: The amount of pressure increases as more gas is added...
destroy.ponder.vat.pressure.text_5: ...and as the space available to the gas is reduced by adding more liquid.
destroy.ponder.vat.pressure.text_6: The opposites are also all true.
destroy.ponder.vat.pressure.text_7: The maximum pressure difference a Vat can withstand is determined by the weakest Block in the Vat's structure.
destroy.ponder.vat.pressure.text_8: If the pressure from the inside of the Vat is too different to the air pressure from outside, the Vat will explode or implode.
destroy.ponder.vat.reading.text_1: Wrench the side of a Vat to add a thermometer.
destroy.ponder.vat.reading.text_2: Wrench twice to add a barometer.
destroy.ponder.vat.reading.text_3: If connected to Redstone, thermometers and barometers give an output signal.
destroy.ponder.vat.reading.text_4: The strength of this signal is interpolated between two values, which can be configured by clicking.
destroy.ponder.vat.reading.text_5: A value below the minimum value will not give a signal.
destroy.ponder.vat.reading.text_6: A value above the maximum value will give a full strength signal.
destroy.ponder.vat.reading.text_7: Any values inbetween will give an interpolated signal.
destroy.ponder.vat.reading.text_8: Threshold switches read the liquid fill level proportional to the Vat's total capacity.
destroy.ponder.vat.reading.text_9: Vats can also be connected to Display Links, and will display their contents.
destroy.ponder.vat.uv.text_1: Some Reactions require ultraviolet light as a catalyst.
destroy.ponder.vat.uv.text_2: Vats receive UV through transparent blocks in the top, regardless of the time of day.
destroy.ponder.vat.uv.text_3: As the level of  Ozone Depletion increases, more UV power reaches the Vat in this way.
destroy.ponder.vat.uv.text_4: More UV power is supplied by Blacklights placed directly adjacent to transparent sides of the Vat.
destroy.generic_reaction.alcohol_dehydra: The {anhydrous, destroy:anhydrous} de{hydration, destroy:hydrolysis} of an [destroy:alcohol] to make an [destroy:alkene].
destroy.generic_reaction.alkene_chlorina: The {electrophilic, destroy:electrophile} {addition, destroy:addition} of [destroy:chlorine] to an [destroy:alkene].
destroy.generic_reaction.alkene_chlorohy: The {electrophilic, destroy:electrophile} {addition, destroy:addition} of [destroy:hypochlorous_acid] to an [destroy:alkene]. The alcohol group gets added to the higher {degree, destroy:degree} carbon.
destroy.generic_reaction.alkene_hydrobor: The {electrophilic, destroy:electrophile} {addition, destroy:addition} of [destroy:diborane] to three [destroy:alkene]s. The borane is added to the higher {degree, destroy:degree} carbon.
destroy.generic_reaction.alkene_borane_h: The {electrophilic, destroy:electrophile} {addition, destroy:addition} of [destroy:diborane] to three [destroy:alkene]s. This usually occurs three times.
destroy.generic_reaction.alkene_hydrochl: The {electrophilic, destroy:electrophile} {addition, destroy:addition} of [destroy:hydrochloric_acid] to an [destroy:alkene]. The chlorine {atom, destroy:atom} gets added to the higher {degree, destroy:degree} carbon.
destroy.generic_reaction.alkene_hydroiod: The {electrophilic, destroy:electrophile} {addition, destroy:addition} of [destroy:hydrogen_iodide] to an [destroy:alkene]. The iodine {atom, destroy:atom} gets added to the higher {degree, destroy:degree} carbon.
destroy.generic_reaction.alkene_iodinati: The {electrophilic, destroy:electrophile} {addition, destroy:addition} of [destroy:iodine] to an [destroy:alkene].
destroy.generic_reaction.alkoxide_proton: The rapid {reprotonation, destroy:proton} of a {basic, destroy:base} {deprotonated, destroy:proton} [destroy:alcohol].
destroy.generic_reaction.alkyne_chlorina: The {electrophilic, destroy:electrophile} {addition, destroy:addition} of [destroy:chlorine] to an [destroy:alkyne].
destroy.generic_reaction.alkyne_chlorohy: The {electrophilic, destroy:electrophile} {addition, destroy:addition} of [destroy:hypochlorous_acid] to an [destroy:alkyne]. The alcohol group gets added to the higher {degree, destroy:degree} carbon.
destroy.generic_reaction.alkyne_hydrolys: The {hydrolysis, destroy:hydrolysis} of an [destroy:alkyne] to form an [destroy:alcohol]. The alcohol group gets added to the higher {degree, destroy:degree} carbon.
destroy.generic_reaction.alkyne_hydrobor: The {electrophilic, destroy:electrophile} {addition, destroy:addition} of [destroy:diborane] to three [destroy:alkyne]s. The borane is added to the higher {degree, destroy:degree} carbon.
destroy.generic_reaction.alkyne_borane_h: The {electrophilic, destroy:electrophile} {addition, destroy:addition} of [destroy:diborane] to three [destroy:alkyne]s. This usually occurs three times.
destroy.generic_reaction.alkyne_hydrochl: The {electrophilic, destroy:electrophile} {addition, destroy:addition} of [destroy:hydrochloric_acid] to an [destroy:alkyne]. The chlorine {atom, destroy:atom} gets added to the higher {degree, destroy:degree} carbon.
destroy.generic_reaction.alkyne_hydroiod: The {electrophilic, destroy:electrophile} {addition, destroy:addition} of [destroy:hydrogen_iodide] to an [destroy:alkyne]. The iodine {atom, destroy:atom} gets added to the higher {degree, destroy:degree} carbon.
destroy.generic_reaction.alkyne_hydrogen: The nickel-{catalyzed, destroy:catalyst} {hydrogenation, destroy:hydrogenation} of an [destroy:alkyne].
destroy.generic_reaction.alkyne_iodinati: The {electrophilic, destroy:electrophile} {addition, destroy:addition} of [destroy:iodine] to an [destroy:alkyne].
destroy.generic_reaction.amine_phosgenat: The reaction of an [destroy:amine] with [destroy:phosgene] to form an [destroy:isocyanate], in {anhydrous conditions, destroy:anhydrous}.
destroy.generic_reaction.borane_oxidatio: The insertion of an oxygen {atom, destroy:atom} over the carbon-boron {bond, destroy:bond}. Easily {hydrolyzed, destroy:hydrolysis} to an [destroy:alcohol].
destroy.generic_reaction.borate_esterifi: The reversible joining of an [destroy:organic_boric_acid] (or just [destroy:boric_acid]) and an [destroy:alcohol]. Continually remove [destroy:water] to favor the products.
destroy.generic_reaction.cyanamide_addit: The {nucleophilic, destroy:nucleophile} {addition, destroy:addition} of an [destroy:amine] to [destroy:cyanamide] to make a guanidine.
destroy.generic_reaction.isocyanate_hydr: The {hydrolysis, destroy:hydrolysis} of an [destroy:isocyanate] into an [destroy:amine], releasing [destroy:carbon_dioxide].
destroy.generic_reaction.nitro_hydrogena: The {hydrogenation, destroy:hydrogenation} of a [destroy:nitro] compound into an [destroy:amine].
destroy.generic_reaction.wolff_kishner_r: The {reduction, destroy:reduction} of a [destroy:carbonyl] to an {alkane, destroy:alkane}.
destroy.reaction.acetylene_trimerization: The combination of three [destroy:acetylene] {molecules, destroy:molecule} into [destroy:benzene].
destroy.reaction.borax_precipitation.des: The {precipitation, destroy:precipitation} of Borax from a {basic, destroy:base} {solution, destroy:solution}.
destroy.reaction.boric_acid_neutralizati: In {basic, destroy:base} {solutions, destroy:solution}, [destroy:boric_acid] converts to [destroy:tetrahydroxyborate] {ions, destroy:ion}.
destroy.reaction.brown_schlesinger_proce: A method for the production of sodium [destroy:borohydride].
destroy.reaction.carbide_hydrolysis.desc: The {hydrolysis, destroy:hydrolysis} of [destroy:calcium_ion] Carbide to produce [destroy:acetylene].
destroy.reaction.carbon_tetrachloride_sy: Also known as "carbon tet", [destroy:carbon_tetrachloride] is a precursor to many ozone-depleting refrigerants.
destroy.reaction.chromate_conversion.des: The interconversion of [destroy:chromate] and [destroy:dichromate] ions. In more {acidic, destroy:acid} solutions, the [destroy:dichromate] dominates.
destroy.reaction.chromium_dissolution.de: The {dissolution, destroy:solution} of chromium in {acid, destroy:acid}.
destroy.reaction.chromium_ore_dissolutio: The {dissolution, destroy:solution} of chromium ore in {acid, destroy:acid} allowing for ore tripling.
destroy.reaction.cyanamide_ion_hydrolysi: The {hydrolysis, destroy:hydrolysis} of the [destroy:cyanamide_ion] {ion, destroy:ion} to produce [destroy:cyanamide].
destroy.reaction.dinitrotoluene_nitratio: A method for the production of [destroy:tnt]. Best to start with [destroy:toluene] and do all nitrations at once.
destroy.reaction.hydrogen_cyanide_dissol: Hydrogen cyanide is a weak acid that does not easily dissociate in water. It can be coaxed into doing so by reacting it with a {destroy:base}.
destroy.reaction.isoprene_polymerization: The {polymerization, destroy:polymer} of [destroy:isoprene] into natural rubber.
destroy.reaction.lead_dissolution.descri: The {dissolution, destroy:solution} of lead in {acid, destroy:acid}.
destroy.reaction.lead_ore_dissolution.de: The {dissolution, destroy:solution} of lead ore in {acid, destroy:acid} allowing for ore tripling.
destroy.reaction.rodrigues_zonetti_proce: A method for the production of [destroy:acetone] from [destroy:ethanol] via catalysis.
destroy.reaction.sodium_amalgamization.d: The {dissolution, destroy:solution} of Sodium metal in [destroy:mercury], or {precipitation, destroy:precipitation} from it.
destroy.reaction.sodium_hydride_formatio: The production of the highly reactive salt Sodium Hydride.
destroy.reaction.sodium_hydride_hydrolys: The vigorous {hydrolysis, destroy:hydrolysis} of sodium hydride.
destroy.reaction.sodium_ingot_dissolutio: The violent, {exothermic, destroy:exothermic} reaction of [destroy:sodium] and [destroy:water] that earns the {alkali, destroy:base} metals their name.
destroy.reaction.sodium_oxide_dissolutio: The dissolution of various oxides of sodium in [destroy:water].
destroy.reaction.tetraborate_equilibrium: The interconversion of various boron oxides in solution.
destroy.reaction.tetraethyllead_synthesi: The synthesis of infamous [destroy:tetraethyllead] from a [destroy:sodium_metal]-lead alloy.
destroy.reaction.vaillant_process.descri: A zeolite-{catalyzed, destroy:catalyst} method for the production of [destroy:phenol] from [destroy:benzene].
destroy.reaction.basalt_combustion.descr: The combustion of basalt to produce [destroy:nitrous_oxide] and [destroy:water].
destroy.recipe.cartography_table.scaled: Map is twice as large as input
destroy.recipe.fireproofing.info: Applicable to most Items in the game
destroy.recipe.mixture_conversion.descri: This _non-Mixture fluid_, when pumped into a Vat or mixed in a Basin _automatically_ converts to this _Mixture_.
destroy.tooltip.eating_prevented.mouth_p: Your protective facewear blocks your mouth
destroy.tooltip.redstone_programmer.add_: Shift-click to add a single note
destroy.tooltip.redstone_programmer.beat: Show a line every nth beat. Set to 0 to disable.
destroy.tooltip.redstone_programmer.line: Make every nth line thicker. Set to 0 to disable.
